meanings.definition: (Latin) to strike against, dash against; to overthrow, ruin; to afflict, distress
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to strike against, dash against; to overthrow, ruin; to afflict, distress

usage_notes.explanation: adfligo is a Latin verb. It is not commonly used in modern English, but it can be found in classical Latin texts.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, not commonly used in modern English. Therefore, readability metrics are not applicable.
